intro: Rotheca bukobensis, commonly known as the Bukoban rotheca, is a flowering plant native to the Eastern African region, particularly Tanzania. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest margins, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and sometimes pubescent, while its flowers are small and clustered in heads. Rotheca bukobensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
